snippet: The Food and Drug Administration approved a new drug from Roche to help treat patients with a type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves new drug from Roche, called Gazyva, to help treat patients with chronic lymphocystic leukemia.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration approved a new drug from Roche to help treat patients with a type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

headline.main: F.D.A. Clears New Cancer-Fighting Drug From Roche
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Clears New Cancer-Fighting Drug From Roche
